intro: Cyrtandra gjellerupii, commonly known as the Hawaiian cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the island of Kauai in Hawaii. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red, yellow, and orange. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and is often found growing in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests. It is considered rare and is listed as endangered due to habitat loss and invasive species. Cyrtandra gjellerupii plays an important ecological role in its native ecosystem, supporting various pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of Hawaiian flora.
